alert.note: Alert for Carter; Garvin; Johnston; Murray; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 12 at 7:50AM CDT until June 12 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Garvin County in southern Oklahoma... Central Carter County in southern Oklahoma... Southwestern Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... Murray County in southern Oklahoma... * Until 830 AM CDT. * At 749 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hennepin, moving east at 50 mph. Another severe thunderstorm was located near Maysville. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Pauls Valley, Sulphur, Davis, Wynnewood, Dickson, Mannsville, Roff, Springer, Elmore City, Katie, Mill Creek, Fitzhugh, Dougherty, Gene Autry, Tatums, Ratliff City, Hickory, Turner Falls, Scullin, and Milo. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
